00025 #ifndef INCLUDE_git_odb_h__
00026 #define INCLUDE_git_odb_h__
00027 
00028 #include "common.h"
00029 #include "types.h"
00030 #include "oid.h"
00031 
00032 /**
00033  * @file git2/odb.h
00034  * @brief Git object database routines
00035  * @defgroup git_odb Git object database routines
00036  * @ingroup Git
00037  * @{
00038  */
00039 GIT_BEGIN_DECL
00040 
00041 /**
00042  * Create a new object database with no backends.
00043  *
00044  * Before the ODB can be used for read/writing, a custom database
00045  * backend must be manually added using `git_odb_add_backend()`
00046  *
00047  * @param out location to store the database pointer, if opened.
00048  *            Set to NULL if the open failed.
00049  * @return GIT_SUCCESS if the database was created; otherwise an error
00050  *         code describing why the open was not possible.
00051  */
00052 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_new(git_odb **out);
00053 
00054 /**
00055  * Create a new object database and automatically add
00056  * the two default backends:
00057  *
00058  *      - git_odb_backend_loose: read and write loose object files
00059  *              from disk, assuming `objects_dir` as the Objects folder
00060  *
00061  *      - git_odb_backend_pack: read objects from packfiles,
00062  *              assuming `objects_dir` as the Objects folder which
00063  *              contains a 'pack/' folder with the corresponding data
00064  *
00065  * @param out location to store the database pointer, if opened.
00066  *            Set to NULL if the open failed.
00067  * @param objects_dir path of the backends' "objects" directory.
00068  * @return GIT_SUCCESS if the database opened; otherwise an error
00069  *         code describing why the open was not possible.
00070  */
00071 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_open(git_odb **out, const char *objects_dir);
00072 
00073 /**
00074  * Add a custom backend to an existing Object DB
00075  *
00076  * Read <odb_backends.h> for more information.
00077  *
00078  * @param odb database to add the backend to
00079  * @paramm backend pointer to a git_odb_backend instance
00080  * @return 0 on sucess; error code otherwise
00081  */
00082 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_add_backend(git_odb *odb, git_odb_backend *backend, int priority);
00083 
00084 /**
00085  * Add a custom backend to an existing Object DB; this
00086  * backend will work as an alternate.
00087  *
00088  * Alternate backends are always checked for objects *after*
00089  * all the main backends have been exhausted.
00090  *
00091  * Writing is disabled on alternate backends.
00092  *
00093  * Read <odb_backends.h> for more information.
00094  *
00095  * @param odb database to add the backend to
00096  * @paramm backend pointer to a git_odb_backend instance
00097  * @return 0 on sucess; error code otherwise
00098  */
00099 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_add_alternate(git_odb *odb, git_odb_backend *backend, int priority);
00100 
00101 /**
00102  * Close an open object database.
00103  * @param db database pointer to close.  If NULL no action is taken.
00104  */
00105 GIT_EXTERN(void) git_odb_close(git_odb *db);
00106 
00107 /** An object read from the database. */
00108 typedef struct {
00109         void *data;          /**< Raw, decompressed object data. */
00110         size_t len;          /**< Total number of bytes in data. */
00111         git_otype type;      /**< Type of this object. */
00112 } git_rawobj;
00113 
00114 /**
00115  * Read an object from the database.
00116  *
00117  * If GIT_ENOTFOUND then out->data is set to NULL.
00118  *
00119  * @param out object descriptor to populate upon reading.
00120  * @param db database to search for the object in.
00121  * @param id identity of the object to read.
00122  * @return
00123  * - GIT_SUCCESS if the object was read;
00124  * - GIT_ENOTFOUND if the object is not in the database.
00125  */
00126 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_read(git_rawobj *out, git_odb *db, const git_oid *id);
00127 
00128 /**
00129  * Read the header of an object from the database, without
00130  * reading its full contents.
00131  *
00132  * Only the 'type' and 'len' fields of the git_rawobj structure
00133  * are filled. The 'data' pointer will always be NULL.
00134  *
00135  * The raw object pointed by 'out' doesn't need to be manually
00136  * closed with git_rawobj_close().
00137  *
00138  * @param out object descriptor to populate upon reading.
00139  * @param db database to search for the object in.
00140  * @param id identity of the object to read.
00141  * @return
00142  * - GIT_SUCCESS if the object was read;
00143  * - GIT_ENOTFOUND if the object is not in the database.
00144  */
00145 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_read_header(git_rawobj *out, git_odb *db, const git_oid *id);
00146 
00147 /**
00148  * Write an object to the database.
00149  *
00150  * @param id identity of the object written.
00151  * @param db database to which the object should be written.
00152  * @param obj object descriptor for the object to write.
00153  * @return
00154  * - GIT_SUCCESS if the object was written;
00155  * - GIT_ERROR otherwise.
00156  */
00157 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_write(git_oid *id, git_odb *db, git_rawobj *obj);
00158 
00159 /**
00160  * Determine if the given object can be found in the object database.
00161  *
00162  * @param db database to be searched for the given object.
00163  * @param id the object to search for.
00164  * @return
00165  * - true, if the object was found
00166  * - false, otherwise
00167  */
00168 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_exists(git_odb *db, const git_oid *id);
00169 
00170 
00171 
00172 
00173 
00174 /**
00175  * Determine the object-ID (sha1 hash) of the given git_rawobj.
00176  *
00177  * The input obj must be a valid loose object type and the data
00178  * pointer must not be NULL, unless the len field is also zero.
00179  *
00180  * @param id the resulting object-ID.
00181  * @param obj the object whose hash is to be determined.
00182  * @return
00183  * - GIT_SUCCESS if the object-ID was correctly determined.
00184  * - GIT_ERROR if the given object is malformed.
00185  */
00186 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_rawobj_hash(git_oid *id, git_rawobj *obj);
00187 
00188 /**
00189  * Release all memory used by the obj structure.
00190  *
00191  * As a result of this call, obj->data will be set to NULL.
00192  *
00193  * If obj->data is already NULL, nothing happens.
00194  *
00195  * @param obj object descriptor to free.
00196  */
00197 GIT_EXTERN(void) git_rawobj_close(git_rawobj *obj);
00198 
00199 /** @} */
00200 GIT_END_DECL
00201 #endif
